title: Hong Kong Exchange Suspends Trading in Derivatives Market for Afternoon
text:
By Saurabh Chaturvedi

Derivatives trading has been suspended on the Hong Kong exchange due to "prolonged connectivity issues," the operator of the bourse said Thursday.

Trading in the derivatives market for the afternoon and after-hours sessions was suspended at 2 p.m. (0600 GMT) on Sept. 5, Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Ltd. said in a notice.

The clearing system for derivatives will remain open for the afternoon session while all other markets remain fully operational, it added.

Shares in Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing are off 0.9% at HK$245.80 while the benchmark Hang Seng Index is down 0.6% at 26370.22.
